answers.author: Mary Van Milligen
answers.text:
The Alliance for Innovation recently hosted a webinar on the City of Schaumburg, Illinois' Talent Management Program. I believe the webinar will still be available on the Alliance for Innovation website (transformgov.org). The Talent Management Program was created to identify and develop high potential employees and avoid the loss of organizational knowledge in response to the possiblity of 60% of City leaders being eligible for retirement in the next 5 years (82% in one department). The program is comprehensive and appears very successful.

answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
The Training and Organizational Development (TOD) Division of Palm Beach County Government (2.11 FTEs) has as one of its primary functions the ongoing implementation of a internal "Leadership Development" program. This program, offered annually to county employees, was created with two objectives: 1.) to enhance the overall effectiveness of leadership in the organization and 2.) to respond to the concern of upper management regarding succession planning "to deal with a potential leadership gap due to the retiring baby boomers."  In 2009, a "Leadership Level I Program" was offered, with a maximum of 20 staff participants, for management training. (Source: PBC Annual Budget Report)

Maria, 
I would be remiss if I didn't at least mention the "Succession Planning" topic page on ICMA's Knowledge Network:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/252/Succession_Planning#Tab=Overview
I'm sure you're aware of it's existence and I'm probably not blowing your mind by mentioning it, but it does have a lot of really great articles, reports and other documents, including the Plano plan Elizabeth mentioned. I would recommend it as your first stop if you haven't already visited. 
Good luck!
Derek Johnson
